name: Ed Finlan Group
address: 425 Commercial St Ste 200 Mount Vernon, WA 98273

yelp_reviews.author: Samantha M.
yelp_reviews.review:
Buyers & Sellers Beware!! 
This was the worse and most stressful experience ever with a real estate company. I'm completely mortified about the way we were treated, and manipulated. We felt extremely mislead, bullied, were given legal advice on multiple accounts and other extremely unethical practices. They pretend to care, but really don't. Very two-faced. The "supervisors" are not any better, they are a joke and don't follow through with a single commitment they make. An alarming fact, the supervisor told me that they deal daily with unhappy clients with their agents!!!! Seriously, daily???? That's a major red flag. Go to John L Scott or Remax, but don't use these guys. 
I wouldn't even give them a single star,  more like 5 thumbs down

yelp_reviews.author: Charles H.
yelp_reviews.review:
Ed Finlan is the definition of a strong Realtor.  He knows the business, the market and possesses huge people skills.  Common sense and integrity combined with an incredible work ethic, sets him apart from the average Realtor.  One other thing, he produces.  

Charles Kent Holyoke

yelp_reviews.author: Catherine W.
yelp_reviews.review: Ed Finlan was a great realtor for my mom when she decided to sell her house.  Ed advised her and assisted in every step of the process, reassuring her when needed.  If you are wanting to buy or sell a home in Mount Vernon, WA, Ed Finlan should be your first call.  He is an absolute necessity!

yelp_reviews.author: Andrea P.
yelp_reviews.review: Ed and company are fantastic. Good communicators, qualified to handle any transaction. Have done at least 10 deals with them.

yelp_reviews.author: Reina G.
yelp_reviews.review: As first-time home buyers, my husband and I couldn't have asked for anyone better than William (Bill) Hornbrook as our agent. He exceeded our expectations. We appreciated his responsiveness and knowledge/insights. As high-strung and stressed as I could be, I appreciated that he was never pushy but always patient even when we saw house after house or got discouraged. We had a deadline a few months away and in a demanding market, he directed us to houses within our criteria and though we had a couple of failed offers, he kept an eye on the house we really wanted so when it came to market he immediately let us know. And we got it! Bill immediately sent all paperwork via secure email for convenient electronic signing and easy download. The search was the most stressful part but once we were in escrow with Guild Mortgage (his recommendation!), it was a breeze. We couldn't be happier with the whole process and our lovely new dream home.

Great

Particularly noteworthy are the sentiments expressed by first-time homebuyers who have praised the Ed Finlan Group for their exceptional assistance throughout the buying process. Detailed in one review was a narrative of patient and supportive interaction, as the realtor was consistently attentive and never pushy, a trait that potential buyers find invaluable. The proactive approach demonstrated by the staff in keeping an eye on desired listings and facilitating a successful purchase has led to commendations for exceeding expectations.

Consistently, user reviews point out the Ed Finlan Group's ability to communicate effectively and smoothly navigate transaction proceedings. This was exemplified by one user's account of completing at least ten deals with the group, indicating a strong level of satisfaction and trust built through multiple transactions. Such experiences portray an image of a dependable and proficient property management company.

Bad

Nonetheless, amidst the favorable accounts, there are also negative experiences shared by some reviewers. One detailed account outlined a deeply troubled interaction characterized by feelings of being misled, bullied, and subjected to unethical practices. Such an experience conveyed a sense of mortification and distress, highlighting the importance of transparency and ethical conduct in property management. This review brings attention to potential areas of improvement concerning the company's customer relations and governance practices.

The absence of any owner responses to negative reviews might be indicative of a lack of engagement with dissatisfied clients or an opportunity to improve customer service protocols. The reviewed concerns are cause for cautious consideration by prospective clients as they may signal systematic issues that could affect future interactions or transactions with the Ed Finlan Group.

Ugly

An alarming element from one dissatisfied review is the mention of frequent daily complaints concerning agents, which the reviewer reported a supervisor had admitted to. Such a claim, if accurate, represents a serious red flag and raises questions about the consistency and quality of services provided by the Ed Finlan Group. It stresses the significance of understanding and addressing the root causes behind such feedback to maintain a reliable reputation.

Lastly, the review mentioned a lack of fulfillment of commitments by so-called supervisors, casting doubts on the overall accountability within the company's hierarchy. Lack of follow-through on commitments can erode trust and have substantial implications for the company's credibility and customer satisfaction. This points to potential deep-seated management issues that the Ed Finlan Group may need to address to ensure long-term success and client loyalty.
